text: Antonio Pacchioni (1665–1726) was an Italian scientist and anatomist, who focused chiefly on the outermost meningeal layer of the brain, the dura mater. Illustration for the review of Disquisitio anatomicae de durae meningis... published on Acta Eruditorum in 1703 Illustration for the review of Dissertatio epistolaris de Glandulis... published on Acta Eruditorum in 1706 Pacchioni's granulations (or pacchionian bodies), where the arachnoid layer protrudes through the dura, are named for him (although they are now generally known as arachnoid granulations). Pacchioni was born in Reggio Emilia, where he later attended university. He received his degree in medicine in 1688, and left for Rome in 1689. Category:Italian anatomists Category:1665 births Category:1726 deaths
title: Antonio Pacchioni
